IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: TRINITY INTERNATIONAL UNIVERSITY OFFERS UNDERGRADUATE, GRADUATE, AND DOCTORAL DEGREES THROUGH FOUR SCHOOLS AT LOCATIONS IN CALIFORNIA, ILLINOIS, AND FLORIDA SERVING NEARLY 3,200 STUDENTS.
IRS990.MissionDescription: TRINITY INTERNATIONAL UNIVERSITY IS AN INSTITUTION OF HIGHER EDUCATION THAT OFFERS BOTH UNDERGRADUATE AND POSTGRADUATE DEGREE PROGRAMS. TRINITY INTERNATIONAL UNIVERSITY EDUCATES MEN AND WOMEN FOR FAITHFUL PARTICIPATION IN GOD'S REDEMPTIVE WORK IN THE WORLD BY CULTIVATING ACADEMIC EXCELLENCE, CHRISTIAN FIDELITY, AND LIFELONG LEARNING. THE UNIVERSITY'S REVENUE AND OTHER SUPPORT ARE DERIVED PRINCIPALLY FROM TUITION AND FEES, AUXILIARY ENTERPRISE REVENUE AND CONTRIBUTIONS.
IRS990.Description: Trinity International University is comprised of several academic programs, offering both traditional and non-traditional degree program options. Trinity College and Trinity Graduate School provide undergraduate and graduate degrees. Trinity Evangelical Divinity School provides master's and doctoral degrees. Trinity Law School provides the juris doctor degree. Student Services provide for student orientation, disability services, academic support, international student support, student publications, ministry to families, mentoring, counseling and health services, and assistance to residence life. Auxiliary Services provide residence and food service options for students.

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: ENDOWMENT FUNDS ARE USED TO FULFILL THE ON-GOING MISSION OF THE ORGANIZATION.
THE AUDITED CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS DO NOT INCLUDE A FOOTNOTE ADDRESSING THE ADOPTION OF FIN-48, ACCOUNTING FOR UNCERTAINTY IN INCOME TAXES.

CHANGE IN VALUE OF SPLIT INTEREST AGREEMENTS $38,027 PART XII, LINE 4B CHANGE IN VALUE OF SPLIT INTEREST AGREEMENTS $38,027 INSTITUTIONAL SCHOLARSHIPS $11,171,248 PART XIII, LINE 4B INSTITUTIONAL SCHOLARSHIPS $11,171,248

IRS990ScheduleE.PubViaBroadcastMediaExpln: THROUGH THE STUDENT HANDBOOK AND THE STUDENT CATALOG.
IRS990ScheduleE.GovtFinancialAidExplanation: TRINITY INTERNATIONAL UNIVERSITY RECEIVES GOVERNMENTAL AID IN THE FORM OF PERKINS AND PELL GRANTS, WORK-STUDY GRANTS, SEOG AND OTHER GRANTS.

Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Explanation: FUNDS ARE DISTRIBUTED BASED ON NEED AND MERIT. STUDENT AID IS HANDLED BY THE Financial Aid Office and Student Accounting AND CREDITED DIRECTLY TO THE STUDENT ACCOUNT. EACH STUDENT APPLIES FOR FINANCIAL AID BY FILLING OUT A FREE APPLICATION FOR FEDERAL STUDENT AID (FAFSA). THE AWARD IS BASED ON THE INFORMATION IN THIS APPLICATION. STUDENTS CAN ALSO APPLY FOR GRANTS AND SCHOLARSHIPS BASED ON ELIGIBILITY.

Form990ScheduleMPartII.Explanation: MERRILL LYNCH IS USED TO RECEIVE AND LIQUIDATE STOCK GIFTS.

GeneralExplanation.Explanation: QUESTION 1B: THE PRESIDENT OF THE UNIVERSITY SERVES ON THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS AND RECEIVES COMPENSATION AS AN EMPLOYEE OF THE UNIVERSITY. DUE TO THIS, THE PRESIDENT IS NOT CONSIDERED AN INDEPENDENT VOTING MEMBER OF THE BOARD. QUESTION 11B: THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS IS PROVIDED WITH THE FORM 990 AND RELATED SCHEDULES FOR REVIEW PRIOR TO SUBMISSION TO THE IRS. QUESTION 12C: THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS IS REQUIRED TO COMPLETE AN ANNUAL CONFLICT OF INTEREST DISCLOSURE. THE DISCLOSURES ARE REVIEWED BY THE POLICY COMMITTEE. IF A CONFLICT IS DISCLOSED, THE BOARD MEMBER WILL RECUSE HIMSELF/ HERSELF FROM DISCUSSIONS. QUESTION 15A & 15B: THE PRESIDENT WAS HIRED IN APRIL 2009. AT THAT TIME, HIS SALARY WAS DETERMINED BY A COMPARABILITY STUDY OF VARIOUS PRESIDENTIAL SALARIES IN THE CONSORTIUM OF COMPARABLE EDUCATIONAL INSTITUTIONS AND THE ASSOCIATION OF THEOLOGICAL SCHOOLS BY AN INDEPENDENT CONSULTING FIRM. THE BOARD REVIEWED THIS PROCESS AND THE CONCLUSIONS REACHED. QUESTION 19: THE FORM 990, FINANCIAL STATEMENTS, GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, AND CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY ARE AVAILABLE UPON REQUEST.
